item.title: My first paper is officially published!
item.description:
ğŸ‘ğŸŠ I’m thrilled to announce that my first research paper “rtestim: Time-varying reproduction number estimation using trend filtering” has just been officially released! ğŸ“Š

ğŸ” This work proposed a method, which is implemented in the R package rtestim, for accurate and computationally efficient estimation of the instantaneous reproduction number, a crucial metric for understanding the spread of infectious diseases.

You can read the full paper here.

I’m incredibly proud of this work and would love to hear your thoughts and feedback. A big thank you to my collaborators and everyone who supported me throughout this journey! ğŸ™ğŸŒŸ
